techmeme.title: Telegram rolls out the ability for creators to share paid content to channels using its Stars digital currency (Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch)
In 2024, 58.5% of Google searches in the US and 59.7% in EU result in zero clicks; for 1,000 searches, 374 clicks go to the open web in the EU and 360 in the US (Rand Fishkin/SparkToro)
Alphabet winds down agriculture startup Mineral, which became an independent subsidiary in 2023, and is licensing some of its tech to berry producer Driscoll's (Julia Love/Bloomberg)
WIPO: between 2014 and 2023, 54K generative AI patents were filed, 25% of which were filed in 2023; China leads with 38K+ patents, followed by the US with 6,276 (Emma Farge/Reuters)
Reddit users: Netflix is phasing out its cheapest $11.99/month ad-free tier for existing subscribers as planned, pushing its $6.99, $15.49, and $22.99 tiers (Emma Roth/The Verge)
